[docs]    @staticmethod
    def is_device_secure_with_pass(device):
        # Check if drive is already secure with user password
        cmd = 'hdparm -I /dev/%s' % (device)
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        for line in output.split('\n'):
            if re.search('enabled', line):
                if 'not' in line:
                    return False
                else:
                    return True



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def is_device_locked(device):
        # Check if drive is in locked state
        cmd = 'hdparm -I /dev/%s' % (device)
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        for line in output.split('\n'):
            if re.search('locked', line):
                if 'not' in line:
                    return False
                else:
                    return True

    def is_device_frozen(device):
        # Check if drive is in frozen state
        cmd = 'hdparm -I /dev/%s' % (device)
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)

                    return False
                else:
                    return True



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def get_device_cachesize(device):
        # Get the cache size of ssd device
        cmd = 'hdparm -I /dev/%s' % (device)
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        pattern = re.compile(r'cache/buffer size  =\s+(\w+)', re.MULTILINE)
        match = re.search(pattern, output)
        if match:
            size = match.group(1)
            return size



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def get_device_type(device):
        # Get SAS or SATA type of device
        cmd = 'hdparm -I /dev/%s | grep Transport' % device
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        if 'SAS' in output:
            return 'SAS'
        elif 'SATA' in output:
            return 'SATA'
        else:
            return 'unknown'



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def get_writecache_state(device):
        # Check the current state of writecache
        cmd = 'hdparm -W /dev/%s' % (device)
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        pattern = re.compile(r'write-caching =\s+(\d+)', re.MULTILINE)
        match = re.search(pattern, output)
        state = int(match.group(1))
        return state



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def get_readlookahead_state(device):
        #  Check the current state of readlookahead
        cmd = 'hdparm -A /dev/%s' % (device)
        output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        pattern = re.compile(r'look-ahead\s+ =\s+(\d+)', re.MULTILINE)
        match = re.search(pattern, output)
        state = int(match.group(1))
        return state



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def writecache_disable(device):
        directory = '/sys/block/' + device + '/device/scsi_disk'
        cmd = 'ls {}'.format(directory)
        filename1 = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        filename2 = directory + '/' + filename1 + '/cache_type'
        cmd = "echo 'write through' > {}".format(filename2)
        AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        # Disable the writce cache value
        cmd = 'hdparm -W0 /dev/%s' % (device)
        AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)

[docs]    @staticmethod
    def ssd_secure_erase(device):
        # Sets a user password if it is not already set
        # Issue the secure erase command
        if not HdparmUtils.is_device_secure_with_pass(device):
            try:
                cmd = 'hdparm --user-master u --security-set-pass pass /dev/%s\
                ' % (device)
                AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
            except:  # noqa: B001 T25377293 Grandfathered in
                logging.info('Error in setting password for /dev/%s' % (device))
        try:
            cmd = 'time hdparm --user-master u --security-erase pass /dev/%s\
                   ' % (device)
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        except:  # noqa: B001 T25377293 Grandfathered in
            logging.info('Error in secure erase for /dev/%s' % (device))



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def repair_sector(sector, device):
        # write zeros to sector using --write-sector option
        try:
            cmd = "dd if=/dev/zero of=/dev/%s bs=4096 \
                count=1 seek=%d" % (device, sector)
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        except BaseException:
            try:
                cmd = 'hdparm --yes-i-know-what-i-am-doing \
                    --write-sector %d /dev/%s' % (sector, device)
                AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
            except:  # noqa: B001 T25377293 Grandfathered in
                raise TestError('Failed to repair sector on /dev/%s' % device)

[docs]    @staticmethod
    def read_sector(sector, device, valid=True):
        # Reads from the specified sector number
        # The sector number must be given (base10) after this option
        try:
            cmd = 'hdparm --read-sector %d /dev/%s' % (sector, device)
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
            logging.info('The sector is successfully read on /dev/%s' % device)
        except:  # noqa: B001 T25377293 Grandfathered in
            if valid:
                raise TestError('Could not read sector on /dev/%s' % device)
            else:
                # This is expected result as we exceeded limit
                logging.info('Expected. Sector is NOT readable on /dev/%s' % device)

    def set_target_op_value(value, device):
        # Set your target over-provisioning condition from original capacity
        try:
            cmd = 'hdparm -N p%d --yes-i-know-what-i-am-doing /dev/%s' % (
                value, device
            )
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
        except:  # noqa: B001 T25377293 Grandfathered in
            pass



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def update_version(mode7_download, firmware_ver_file, device):
        if mode7_download:
            download_type = "--fwdownload-mode7"
        else:
            download_type = "--fwdownload"
        command = 'hdparm %s  %s --please-destroy-my-drive'\
                      ' --yes-i-know-what-i-am-doing /dev/%s'\
                      % (download_type, firmware_ver_file, device)
        AutovalUtils.run_get_output(command)
